profile.name: Rick Spence
profile.title: PROGRAM/PROJECT MANAGER
profile.description: Rick Spence is a highly accomplished and results-oriented Program/Project Manager with extensive experience in leading and delivering complex projects and programs within the Australian Defence Force and various government agencies.  His expertise spans end-to-end project management, risk mitigation, milestone achievement, and resource coordination.  A highly organized and detail-oriented leader, Rick possesses exceptional communication and negotiation skills, effectively collaborating with internal teams, vendors, and stakeholders.  His proven ability to manage multiple teams, mentor junior staff, and implement Agile methodologies (SAFe 6.0) demonstrates his leadership capabilities and commitment to delivering exceptional results.  Rick's experience includes successful digital transformations, cloud migration projects (Azure and AWS), and the development and implementation of PMO frameworks. He consistently exceeds expectations, as evidenced by his achievements in streamlining processes, improving cyber security maturity levels, and creating innovative solutions to complex challenges.
profile.description2: Rick's career showcases a consistent pattern of exceeding expectations and delivering significant value to his clients.  He has a proven track record of successfully navigating challenging projects, often involving substantial budgets and complex stakeholder relationships.  His expertise in Agile methodologies, including SAFe, Scrum, and PRINCE2, allows him to adapt to diverse project environments and deliver projects on time and within budget.  Rick's commitment to continuous improvement is evident in his proactive approach to identifying and resolving project risks, optimizing processes, and mentoring team members.  He is a forward-thinking professional with a strong understanding of ITIL, ITSM, and SIAM frameworks, making him ideally suited for roles requiring strategic planning, execution, and leadership within dynamic and demanding environments.  His ambition and career focus align perfectly with the opportunity to contribute to a company's success while furthering his own professional growth.

keyAchievements: Successfully implemented SAFe 6.0 for the DSE Program (JP9111, DEF2222, JP2181), optimizing Jira and Confluence and developing LACE Teams governance.
Created a chargeback system for Services Australia generating income streams for work done for DSS, NDIA, and DVA.
Successfully rescued a failing project for DSS, uplifting their network to PROTECTED, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills and leadership.

experience.title: Principal Consultant - Jigsaw Notions (PgO Business Transformation Team)
responsibilities: Served as RTE, Agile Coach, Scrum Master, and LACE member for Department of Defense projects.
Managed up to 9 teams comprising engineers, testers, developers, and cybersecurity professionals.
Mentored 6 project support officers/Scrum Masters.
Managed Jira boards and acted as Jira client-side admin for multiple projects.

experience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - Department of Industry and Science (Cloud Platforms)
responsibilities: Identified improvements for the Microsoft Azure Cloud Platforms Team to transition into 2024.
Organized their DevOps environment, ensuring data documentation.
Built their first PowerBI dashboard and provided guidance to fellow cloud PMs.
Managed the "Tech Readiness" project for Microsoft Co-Pilot.

fullExperience.title: Principal Consultant - Jigsaw Notions (PgO Business Transformation Team)
responsibilities: Served as RTE, Agile Coach, Scrum Master, and LACE member for Department of Defense projects JP9111, DEF2222, and the PMO for the Digital Transformation program.
Managed up to 9 teams (engineers, testers, developers, technical writers, and cybersecurity teams).
Managed, supported, and mentored 6 project support officers/Scrum Masters.
Consulted on, created, and configured all Jira boards, acting as JP9111, DEF2222, and JP2181 Jira client-side admin.
Coached PSOs on becoming Scrum Masters and Scrum Masters on furthering their skills.
Coached team members (APS/ADF/Contractors) on PI/ART events, Agile ways of working, and Jira.
Worked with JP9111 & DEF2222 as the product manager.
Provided clarity, direction, and execution on DDG ways of working and Agile best practices for JP9111 and DEF2222.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - Department of Industry and Science (Cloud Platforms)
responsibilities: Worked within the Microsoft Azure Cloud Platforms Team to identify improvements for 2024.
Organized their DevOps environment, ensuring all necessary data was documented.
Built their first PowerBI dashboard to display key DevOps information.
Provided guidance to fellow cloud PMs on projects, governance, and best practices.
Managed their "Tech Readiness" project for Microsoft Co-Pilot in conjunction with the DTA.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - CSIRO
responsibilities: Served as Product Owner and project manager for Data Stewards and Software Coding projects.
Implemented data management practices and industry-accepted software coding and repository frameworks within Microsoft Azure.
Leveraged digital library, cybersecurity, and training teams for staff training.
Uplifted the cybersecurity maturity level within the projects.
Created CSIRO's first PM mentorship program.
Collaborated with CSIRO executives on building their PMO.

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Jacobs Australia (DDG, Department of Defense)
responsibilities: Analyzed a backlog of over 120 projects as part of the PMO, assessing in-flight projects against the gates process.
Worked with the executive team to hire 3 PMs, BAs, and engineers.
Structured the program and developed the budget for board approval.
Created a SAFe methodology framework tailored for the department.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Program Manager - Department of Defense (SOMIIC)
responsibilities: Re-established alignment within the SOMIIC team and stakeholder connections.
Built and delivered a project/portfolio framework.
Managed projects with budgets up to billions of dollars across the Australian Defence Force.
Managed the build-out of ServiceNow along the SAFe model.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Program Manager - The Architecture Practice (TAP) (Department of Defense, Dept. Aged Care)
responsibilities: Collaborated with TAP ICT solution architects and partners to interview stakeholders.
Provided analysis and recommendations for future work within Microsoft Azure.
Guided the Defense cyber team through their iRAP process.
Shaped the scheduling timeline and financial aspects of the ADF recompete bid (valued at 2.1 billion).

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Projects Assured (Services Australia, NDIA, DSS, DVA)
responsibilities: Created a Digital Transformation and Data Management program of work within the PMO.
Managed 6 internal work streams, 4 agencies, Microsoft, contractors, and vendors in Microsoft Azure.
Created a chargeback system for Services Australia generating revenue.
Successfully delivered a project for DSS, uplifting their network to PROTECTED.
Managed the cyber team to achieve maturity level 2 and developed a future roadmap.

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Veritec (CDPP, The AEC, The Nine Network)
responsibilities: Managed the upgrade of CDPP's Mobile Device Management system and network uplift to PROTECTED.
Worked as a member of the PMO.
Managed the Nine Network's digital transformation project from Google to Microsoft Azure.

fullExperience.title: Program Director - Diversity Array Technologies (DArT) (CIMMYT Mexico, Internal company)
responsibilities: Assessed, recommended changes, and executed plans, while hiring additional staff and managing a major client.
Structured projects, resources, and budgeting, working with major clients.
Trained DArT staff and CIMMYT (Mexico) on Scrum Agile and best practices for software development in AWS.
Served as the direct customer-facing delivery manager for CIMMYT, working in Mexico.
Managed framework improvements and updates to service integration and management systems.

fullExperience.title: Program Director - American Driveline (AAMCO)
responsibilities: Program managed the company's largest modernization program, turning it from a deficit to a profit.
Built teams that delivered a Digital Modernization and Data Management program in Microsoft Azure.
Traveled extensively throughout the US and Canada, training franchisees.
Created a CRM dashboard providing data on job pricing, parts costs, and revenue information.
